snippet.title: Hotel manager thwarts holdup
snippet.content: POLICE are investigating the attempted armed robbery of a hotel at Crestmead in the early hours of Wednesday. Police reported a man entering the Julie St hotel through the unlocked front door at 4am. The report said the man approached the 52-year-old male duty manager and demanded money. The manager yelled at the man and chased him out of the hotel. The offender was last seen running eastbound towards Crescendo Place. No money was stolen, nobody was injured andand the manager did not see any weapon. The offender is described as being caucasian, 182cm tall, wearing a balaclava, long sleeve white shirt, black long pants and had an orange high-visibility shirt draped over his shoulder covering his left hand. If you have information, contact Policelink on 131 444.
